results.title: Getting around in French
results.creator_credit: Harry Mehlman and Educational TV Services
results.brief_description: Students from Assumption College, Kilmore and Nunawading HIgh School are shown in a number of situations using French language skills they have acquired from the Eclair French language course. Various situations are depicted and the program concludes with students giving their opinions on the Eclair course of study.

results.title: Tropical circulation
results.creator_credit: Churchill Films and Institut für Film und Bild
results.brief_description: Examines the movement of air in tropical regions with some reference to polar areas. Explains how the rotations of the earth and the seasonal movements of the sun affect wind direction and rainfall in the tropical regions. No other credits available.

results.title: Sir John Everett Millais
results.creator_credit: Anita Sterner, Kenneth Gordon and BBC
results.brief_description: Made to celebrate the 150th anniversary of Millais’ birth. This program retraces his life and work through letters to and from his contemporaries and through a large collection of paintings and drawings. Provides a complement to “The Pre-Raphaelite revolt”. Narrated by Anne Massey.

results.title: Schichlegruber: doing the Lambeth Walk
results.brief_description: Clever editing is used to show Hitler and his elite guard marching and dancing to the popular British song of the war years “The Lambeth Walk”.

results.title: How green plants make and use food. - Rev. ed.
results.brief_description: Uses clear animation and time-lapse microphotography to show how materials reach the leaves of a plant from the roots and how light supplies the energy for the manufacture of sugar. Clarifies the difference between food and raw materials and between photosynthesis and cellular respiration. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.
results.title_for_label: How green plants make and use food. - Rev. ed.

Clarifies the difference between food and raw materials and between photosynthesis and cellular respiration. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Elvis on tour
results.creator_credit: Robert Abel, Pierre Adigel and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Presents a portrait of Elvis Presley’s life. Shows Elvis speaking publicly for the first time about his life and career; rare footage of his early days; performance of his greatest hits including “Love me tender” and offstage moments.

results.title: Conflict
results.creator_credit: Halina Sztynda, Melanie Guiney and Dept of Conservation, Forests and Land
results.brief_description: Presents the views of the Forest Commission, loggers and conservationists in regard to logging practices in East Gippsland. Allows the viewer to draw conclusions about the attitudes and prejudices of the conservationists and the loggers and saw millers.

results.title: Computer: tool for the future
results.creator_credit: Yves Gerard Issembert, Sidney Platt and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: A look at the history of tools such as the abacus, adding machines and computers, the recent developments in computer technology and how computers are used to manage information and various applications of computers today. Also mentions some of the concerns that computerization raises.

results.title: Autistic child: a behavioural approach
results.creator_credit: William Rose and CRM Educational Films
results.brief_description: Describes some of the characteristic behaviours exhibited by autistic children and illustrates the use of detailed behavioural techniques to teach language and apropriate behaviour. Shows how training in language and social skills can make a dramatic difference in outcome for autistic children.
